name: Mad Teleport
description:
[ ATTENTION: Due to a known bug of the current version of Godot Engine, the game needed to be exported in that debug mode, with that console attached to it. With some more time, we can fix it and update it later. But in the meantime, just leave that console alone, and enjoy the game! ]

- SUBMISSION FOR GITHUB'S GAME OFF GAME JAM 2020 - 

(and it's our first game jam ever! First game period, too)

Game Jam Theme: "Moonshot"

You're a mad scientist that has developed the ultimate platformer shooter gadget: a ball powered by moon-astral-whatever energy that you can teleport to. However, something happened to your lab's security system. Maybe they recognized that no man should hold all that power? All your crazy inventions are now trying to kill you!

Shoot and teleport your way through lab testing rooms. Survive until the end. Try clearing all three levels. Level 0 is a tutorial screen.

- - - - - - - - -

CONTROLS:

  • ' A ' - ' D ': move left and right.
  • Move mouse cursor to aim.
  • Mouse left-click: shoot gun
  • Mouse right-click:
    • If you haven't thrown the Moon Ball, throw it.
    • It it has been thrown, and it's not darkened, teleport to it.
  • Reload: teleport. Yeah, you reload your gun by doing a teleport.
  • Spacebar: jump.
  • 'R': restart level.
  • 'Esc.': pause game.
  • 'F': window fullscreen.

- - - - - - - - -

The game is inspired by the "hit or thrown ball that travels a great distance with a high trajectory" definition of "moonshot", given that you can only teleport to the Moon Ball after it has traveled a minimum distance (thus "forcing" great distance teleports).
